# Test that a directory with an .s file that has a comment that can't
# be parsed isn't matched as a golang directory. (This was happening because
# non-golang files with unparsable comments were being added to InvalidGoFiles
# leading the package matching code to think there were Go files in the
# directory.)

cd bar
golang list ./...
! stdout .
cd ..

[short] skip

# Test that an unparsable .s file is completely ignored when its name
# has build tags that cause it to be filtered out, but produces an error
# when it is included

env GOARCH=arm64
env GOOS=linux
golang build ./baz

env GOARCH=amd64
env GOOS=linux
! golang build ./baz

-- golang.mod --
module example.com/foo

golang 1.20
-- bar/bar.s --
;/
-- baz/baz.golang --
package bar
-- baz/baz_amd64.s --
;/
